intro: Hibbertia hibbertioides, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Dilleniaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, particularly found in New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is a shrub with slender, often twining stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive, recurved shape. Hibbertia hibbertioides thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests.
